meanings.definition: The quality or state of being smoky.
meanings.sent1: The smokinesses of the room made it feel cozy and warm.
meanings.sent2: I could smell the delicious smokinesses of the barbecue from down the street.
meanings.sent3: The smokinesses of the campfire reminded me of toasted marshmallows.
meanings.sent4: The smokinesses of the forest enveloped me like a comforting blanket.
meanings.sent5: Her painting captured the smokinesses of the old fireplace perfectly.

meanings.definition: The presence of a smoky flavor or aroma.
meanings.sent1: The chef added just the right amount of smokinesses to the dish.
meanings.sent2: The smokinesses of the bacon filled the kitchen with a mouth-watering scent.
meanings.sent3: The smokinesses of the barbecue sauce made my taste buds dance with joy.
meanings.sent4: The smokinesses of the whiskey lingered in the air long after the glass was empty.
meanings.sent5: The smokinesses of the roasted coffee beans woke me up instantly.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a smoky appearance or atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The smokinesses of the room were enhanced by the dim lighting.
meanings.sent2: The smokinesses of the fog made the landscape look mysterious and eerie.
meanings.sent3: The smokinesses of the movie set added to the dramatic effect of the scene.
meanings.sent4: The smokinesses of the old photographs gave them a nostalgic feel.
meanings.sent5: The smokinesses of the mountain air hinted at a distant wildfire.
